intro: Knautia hirpina, commonly known as the Alpine knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine meadows, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, fluffy seed heads that aid in wind pollination. Knautia hirpina is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
